page.title: 12LODSMILL,LODSWORTH
page.content: {Lodsmill,}close by{Lod's Bridge}over the Rother between Halfway Bridge and Selham, is the business address of {James Morley & Sons Ltd.}and{ W.L.West {& Sons Ltd. } Mr. West introduced our class to Mr.Challen who had worked in the timber yard for 45 years. {TIMBER MERCHANTS {FENCING CONTRACTORS { MANUFACTURERS OF CHESTNUT FENCING We saw piles and piles of sawn timber, seasoning in the yard or just waiting to be made into{gates}or{fences. }Huge trucks carried whole treetrunks. Mr. Challen took us to his workshop where he assembled the 20 yard lengths of {chestnut fencing; } Beverley found the count of 1,1,2,3, working the wire machine, a bit confusing. Carla thought her dad looked strange with ear-defenders but Mr.Enticknap still waved to us all as we left the yard.
